title: SKPaint.MeasureText always returns 0 when run on Linux Docker
body:
**Description**

I'm trying to use SkiaSharp with a ASP.NET Core 6.0 web application I'm developing to run on a Linux-based (Synology) server. I am trying to create a function which converts a string to an image, however the code provided below is condensed to only the issue.

**Code**

```
public void HelloWorld() {
	String text = "Hello, World!!!";
	using (SKFont font = new(SKTypeface.Default, 16)) {
		Single textSize;
		SKRect textBounds = new();
		using (SKPaint tempPaint = new(font)) {
			textSize = tempPaint.MeasureText(text, ref textBounds);
		}
	}
}
```

**Expected Behavior**

When run from IIS Express, it results in a SKRect object with dimensions 98x14.

**Actual Behavior**

When run on a Linux docker, the SKPaint.MeasureText call always returns a value 0; and when called with the overload which takes a SKRect reference parameter, the resulting SKRect describes a zero-area region (zero length, zero height).

**Basic Information**

- Version with issue:  SkiaSharp v2.88.0, SkiaSharp.NativeAssets.Linux.NoDependencies v2.88.00
- Last known good version:  Haven't tried with previous versions.
- IDE:  Visual Studio 2022 Version 17.2.5 (64-bit)
- Platform Target Frameworks:
  - Linux:  alpine (off of Docker)
- Target Devices:
  - Linux-based docker image
  - Synology server
